video.title: The Dangers of Being a Web Developer
video.description:
Web development is an amazing field—easy to get into, straight forward to grow skills, great to build a reputation. The sky is the limit. It turns out, being a web developer is not all roses: on great opportunities that lead to obscure problems that ask for humble solutions.

Talk by Jens Oliver Meiert at the beyond tellerrand conference.

Information about beyond tellerrand:
🔗https://beyondtellerrand.com/
🔗https://twitter.com/btconf

This talk is under the creative commons license. freeCodeCamp is not associated with this talk. We're just excited to bring more exposure to to it!

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

topLevelComment.author: stookie222
topLevelComment.text: interesting flow of ideas. i think the main idea was to present humble of web development profession. all other co-relating ideas were also ok to think about.

topLevelComment.author: wicccked
topLevelComment.text: 43 minutes and not a single important point made

topLevelComment.author: yashashav_dk
topLevelComment.text: Can someone be kind enough to list out all the books which he mentioned. Thanks in advance stranger!

replies.author: Coga
replies.text: What's the danger ? i  didn't understand

replies.author: lalaithan
replies.text:
Bruce Eckel, Thinking in Java
Steve Krug, Don't make me think
Jakob Nielson, Homepage Usability
BJ Fogg, Persuasive Technology
Robert Bringhurst, Elements of Typographical Style
a lot books by Edward Tufte about information design

topLevelComment.author: iTech
topLevelComment.text: As a Software Engineer/Developer, YOU! YES, YOU should always have a B plan in any field or in the software field (being a web dev and also something else like iOS dev). But I'm just a beginner :)!
